S3.T1.caption: Table 1:  The definition of backdoor description symbols.
references: We first illustrate backdoor attacks by the notions and their definition of backdoor in Table 1. We denote the classifier fθ:𝒳→𝒴:subscript𝑓𝜃→𝒳𝒴f_{\theta}:\mathcal{X}\rightarrow\mathcal{Y}, where θ𝜃\theta signifies model parameters, 𝒳∈RT,C𝒳superscript𝑅𝑇𝐶\mathcal{X}\in R^{T,C} being the instance space, and 𝒴=[1,2,…,K]𝒴12…𝐾\mathcal{Y}=[1,2,...,K] being the label space. The T,C𝑇𝐶T,C represent the sequence length and channel number. Let ℱt:𝒳→𝒳:subscriptℱ𝑡→𝒳𝒳\mathcal{F}_{t}:\mathcal{X}\rightarrow\mathcal{X} indicates the attacker-specified trigger function and ℱy:𝒴→𝒴:subscriptℱ𝑦→𝒴𝒴\mathcal{F}_{y}:\mathcal{Y}\rightarrow\mathcal{Y} indicates label shifting function. Before attacking, the clean training dataset is prepared that is signified as D={(xi,yi)}i=1N𝐷subscriptsuperscriptsubscript𝑥𝑖subscript𝑦𝑖𝑁𝑖1D=\{(x_{i},y_{i})\}^{N}_{i=1}, then, the attacker will design the poisoned subset that is conducted by Ds={ℱt​(xj),ℱy​(yj)}j=1Msubscript𝐷𝑠subscriptsuperscriptsubscriptℱ𝑡subscript𝑥𝑗subscriptℱ𝑦subscript𝑦𝑗𝑀𝑗1D_{s}=\{\mathcal{F}_{t}(x_{j}),\mathcal{F}_{y}(y_{j})\}^{M}_{j=1} where the replaced subset is Dr={(xk,yk)}k=1Msubscript𝐷𝑟subscriptsuperscriptsubscript𝑥𝑘subscript𝑦𝑘𝑀𝑘1D_{r}=\{(x_{k},y_{k})\}^{M}_{k=1}. Finally, the poisoned dataset is mixed by Dp=(D−Dr)∪Dssubscript𝐷𝑝𝐷subscript𝐷𝑟subscript𝐷𝑠D_{p}=(D-D_{r})\cup D_{s}. Backdoor attacks request the model to optimize fθsubscript𝑓𝜃f_{\theta} by following the training objective.

S4.T2.caption: Table 2:  Evaluation of backdoor attack methods on KWS task. Each item shows the  A ​ V / A ​ S ​ R / P ​ N 𝐴 𝑉 𝐴 𝑆 𝑅 𝑃 𝑁 AV/ASR/PN  in the table.

S4.T3.caption: Table 3:  Evaluation of backdoor attack methods on TSER task. Each item shows the  A ​ V / A ​ S ​ R / P ​ N 𝐴 𝑉 𝐴 𝑆 𝑅 𝑃 𝑁 AV/ASR/PN  in the table.

S4.T4.caption: Table 4:  The stealthiness evaluation with all triggers.
references: Table 4 shows all the evaluations of speech backdoor methods’ TCR and WER. We also show mel spectrograms with different triggers in Figure 5. As shown in Table 4. We use baseline and proposed triggers in the evaluation to form an utterance pair. Then, we test whether the clean and poisoned ones can be derived from the same speaker and content by a speaker verification system and automatic speech recognition system. Our proposed method can retain the content and timbre well, while the TCR and WER are close to 111 and 00 in stretching or squeezing operations. The VSVC trigger gets very low TCR and high TCR because the timbre converts completely. The PBSM trigger does not change timbre but slightly destroys speech quality. Thus, the WER result is not better than our proposed method’; The other triggers cause significant damage to speech quality, resulting in lower TCR and WER. Generally, the methods that keep timbre and content unchanged can deceive automatic deep detection and gain good stealthiness.

Table 4 shows all the evaluations of speech backdoor methods’ TCR and WER. We also show mel spectrograms with different triggers in Figure 5. As shown in Table 4. We use baseline and proposed triggers in the evaluation to form an utterance pair. Then, we test whether the clean and poisoned ones can be derived from the same speaker and content by a speaker verification system and automatic speech recognition system. Our proposed method can retain the content and timbre well, while the TCR and WER are close to 111 and 00 in stretching or squeezing operations. The VSVC trigger gets very low TCR and high TCR because the timbre converts completely. The PBSM trigger does not change timbre but slightly destroys speech quality. Thus, the WER result is not better than our proposed method’; The other triggers cause significant damage to speech quality, resulting in lower TCR and WER. Generally, the methods that keep timbre and content unchanged can deceive automatic deep detection and gain good stealthiness.

S4.T5.caption: Table 5:  Ablation study. The ASR with different hyper-parameters
references: Effects of Poisoning Number: We replace the poisoning rate with the poisoning number because our proposed trigger is effective and needs a very low number of poisoning samples. The poisoning rate corresponding to 50 samples is 0.22%percent0.220.22\%. As shown in Table 5, the ASR increases with the increase in the number of poisoning number in general. It is indicated that in cases of low poisoning rates, compared to squeezing.
